body:
ghosted⎜p.p

summary: you’re in love with him, but he’s in love with her. not my gif!

warnings: angst, fluff, swearing, just all the feels.

wc: 990

masterlist⎜insp.

you made your way down the halls of midtown, bumping passed the people who took up most of the hallway. you made your way passed peter’s locker, spotting him and ned. you smiled, making eye contact with ned. you started making your way over, but mj arrived next to the pair, taking all of peter’s attention. 

you glanced back and forth between ned and mj, ned sending you a soft smile as you walked passed your three friends, opting out on standing with them. ned nudged peter’s foot, which caused him to look over at his best friend.

“what?” peter asked.

“what’s missing here?” ned asked, gesturing at your lack of presence. peter shrugged, attention turning back to mj, smiling as she talked to him about the latest book she read.

ned rolled his eyes, leaning over and flicking his forehead,”dude!”

“ow! what?!” peter asked, scrunching up his eyebrows.

“you’re serious right now?”

peter sent his friend a confused expression. 

“uno,” ned pointed to himself,”dos,” he pointed at peter,”tres.” he pointed at the empty air next to him.

“what does that mean?”

“dude, c’mon! you’re seriously that fucking oblivious that you don’t even realize y/n isn’t standing with us.”

he shrugged,”maybe she’s running late.”

the bell cut the pair off and peter wrapped his arm around mj’s shoulder,”i’ll catch you at lunch.”

ned rolled his eyes, walking down the hallway to where you were watching behind your locker door.

“he’s becoming a real asshole.”

you chuckled,”well, that’s not surprising.”

“i mean, seriously! he didn’t even realize that you weren’t there!”

you felt the lump in your throat grow, nodding softly,”yep..”

“y/n-”

“i’m gonna be late to english.” you sent him a reassuring smile, but ned watched with concern as you walked down the hallway, hand coming up to your cheek to wipe the tear away. he sighed, turning on his own heels to walk towards his own class.

by the time lunch rolled around, you were convinced that peter parker had thought you were invisible. when you went to go sit in your usual spot in chemistry, mj was sitting there, peter watching her with love filled eyes.

you were happy for him, you really were, but there was this jealous ping that struck your heart anytime you saw the two of them together. it made your blood boil but made you want to sob at the same time.

you loved peter parker, but he was in love with michelle jones.

you took your usual spot next to ned, the next seat over being peter’s. when he walked up to your table, mj’s hand in his, he frowned before looking at you.

“hey, do you mind sitting on the other side of ned so mj can sit?”

ned looked back at his best friend, disbelief written on his expression. you swallowed, feeling everyone at your table watch you get up from your spot, slamming your lunch tray down on the other side of ned, lettuce from your salad flinging onto flash.

“yo, keep your school lettuce off the gucci-”

“shut the fuck up, flash!” you yelled, blood boiling at this point. it was the small things that ticked you off, from the fact that he didn’t notice you this morning, to your seat in chemistry, and now your seat at lunch. yeah, you were pretty ticked off.

flash swallowed, nodding as he watched you pick at the greens. you finally threw your plastic fork down, grabbing your backpack from the table before taking your phone out of your back pocket.

“where are you going?” ned asked.

“anywhere that isn’t near peter fucking parker.” you mumbled, peter’s head snapping up at your mention of his name. he watched as you walked off, leaving the cafeteria. 

“hold on, mj,” he said, cutting her off in the middle of her sentence,”i’ll be back, alright?”

she nodded, watching as her boyfriend ran after you. he watched as you wiped the tears from your eyes, making your way down the hall quickly.

“y/n!” he called,”what’s wrong?”

“why the fuck do you care?” you asked, spinning around so fast that your backpack flung off your shoulder. he watched with wild eyes, seeing the mascara form at your undereyes. 

“because i’m your best friend…?”

“doesn’t feel like it, peter!” you were yelling, not really caring about the fact that teachers could probably hear you,”you’ve been ignoring me since you got the balls to ask mj out! don’t act like i haven’t noticed because i have! jesus, you’re so far up her ass i’m surprised you’re even standing here right now!”

he pulled his eyebrows together,”what’re you talking about?!”

“you know what i’m talking about!” you said, running a hand through your hair,”ned’s been trying to get you to even acknowledge my existence lately and all i get in return is ‘hey can you move’? really peter?”

he finally realized as he watched you storm up to him,”y/n-”

“and to think,” you laughed,”i was actually falling for you, peter.” 

his eyes widened, his heart twisting as you admitted your feelings for him. 

you let out a sob, hand weakly shoving against his shoulder. you wish you weren’t so vulnerable when it came to him, but you couldn’t help it.

he grabbed your arm, pulling you into his chest,”y/n-”

you wrapped your arms around his torso loosely, sobbing into his sweater,”i love you, dammit.”

he frowned, leaning his head on yours,”i know, i’m sorry, y/n.”

his voice was softer than a feather but it shattered you like glass. you buried your face into his chest, hiccuping after sobbing for a couple minutes. you pulled away, cheeks turning hot in embarrassment,”god, i’m sorry, i’m so sorry-”

“don’t even think about apologizing to me,” he said,”never apologize for your feelings.”

you stayed silent for a moment,”promise me something, pete?”

“mm?”

“treat her right,” you said,”she’s a great girl, don’t fuck it up.”

he nodded, pressing a kiss to your hair,”i promise.”

you loved peter parker, but he was in love with michelle jones.

you took your usual spot next to ned, the next seat over being peter’s. when he walked up to your table, mj’s hand in his, he frowned before looking at you.

“hey, do you mind sitting on the other side of ned so mj can sit?”

ned looked back at his best friend, disbelief written on his expression. you swallowed, feeling everyone at your table watch you get up from your spot, slamming your lunch tray down on the other side of ned, lettuce from your salad flinging onto flash.

“yo, keep your school lettuce off the gucci-”

“shut the fuck up, flash!” you yelled, blood boiling at this point. it was the small things that ticked you off, from the fact that he didn’t notice you this morning, to your seat in chemistry, and now your seat at lunch. yeah, you were pretty ticked off.

flash swallowed, nodding as he watched you pick at the greens. you finally threw your plastic fork down, grabbing your backpack from the table before taking your phone out of your back pocket.

“where are you going?” ned asked.

“anywhere that isn’t near peter fucking parker.” you mumbled, peter’s head snapping up at your mention of his name. he watched as you walked off, leaving the cafeteria. 

“hold on, mj,” he said, cutting her off in the middle of her sentence,”i’ll be back, alright?”

she nodded, watching as her boyfriend ran after you. he watched as you wiped the tears from your eyes, making your way down the hall quickly.

“y/n!” he called,”what’s wrong?”

“why the fuck do you care?” you asked, spinning around so fast that your backpack flung off your shoulder. he watched with wild eyes, seeing the mascara form at your undereyes. 

“because i’m your best friend…?”

“doesn’t feel like it, peter!” you were yelling, not really caring about the fact that teachers could probably hear you,”you’ve been ignoring me since you got the balls to ask mj out! don’t act like i haven’t noticed because i have! jesus, you’re so far up her ass i’m surprised you’re even standing here right now!”

he pulled his eyebrows together,”what’re you talking about?!”

“you know what i’m talking about!” you said, running a hand through your hair,”ned’s been trying to get you to even acknowledge my existence lately and all i get in return is ‘hey can you move’? really peter?”

he finally realized as he watched you storm up to him,”y/n-”

“and to think,” you laughed,”i was actually falling for you, peter.” 

his eyes widened, his heart twisting as you admitted your feelings for him. 

you let out a sob, hand weakly shoving against his shoulder. you wish you weren’t so vulnerable when it came to him, but you couldn’t help it.

he grabbed your arm, pulling you into his chest,”y/n-”

you wrapped your arms around his torso loosely, sobbing into his sweater,”i love you, dammit.”

he frowned, leaning his head on yours,”i know, i’m sorry, y/n.”

his voice was softer than a feather but it shattered you like glass. you buried your face into his chest, hiccuping after sobbing for a couple minutes. you pulled away, cheeks turning hot in embarrassment,”god, i’m sorry, i’m so sorry-”

“don’t even think about apologizing to me,” he said,”never apologize for your feelings.”

you stayed silent for a moment,”promise me something, pete?”

“mm?”

“treat her right,” you said,”she’s a great girl, don’t fuck it up.”

he nodded, pressing a kiss to your hair,”i promise.”

“what?” peter asked.

“what’s missing here?” ned asked, gesturing at your lack of presence. peter shrugged, attention turning back to mj, smiling as she talked to him about the latest book she read.

summary: A Blast From The Past? Or Is It The Future?
body:
A Blast From The Past? Or Is It The Future?

Word Count: 1,253

.

This contains tiny endgame spoilers~~

.

Read at your own risk~~

.

Warnings: Spoilers

.

.

    The cool summer breeze blew over the ocean calming Sydney. She let her short light brown hair flow with the wind as she meditated. She smelled the saltiness of the water, feeling the wind bring it up to kiss her cheeks from where she sat on her families dock.

    She couldn’t remember the last time she felt this calm.

           She knew her great grandfather had travelled back in time to stay with her great grandmother, and that most of her memories were messed up. He told her himself since he wanted her to know of his past that was in the future. Sure she could see the resemblance in the history books that she read for fun, but she never really thought of it until he brought it up.

Since her family was one of the smartest thanks to her Great-grandmother she didn’t attend public school, or any school at all really. Sydney Rogers was a mystery to the world just the way her parent’s wanted. Not that she minded all too much; she spent her time reading up on her great-grandfather’s past rendezvous, and all about Tony Stark’s findings in the scientific field, only having access because her Grandpa Steve asked Pepper for the access codes to his files. Pepper allowed it because she figured that someone is gonna need to continue to further Tony’s work and who better than someone that is the descendant of Steve Rogers.

However, Sydney’s relaxation didn’t last long before her father called her for supper, which completely ruined her concentration on the world around her and put her back in a slightly sour mood.

She sighed and pulled herself up from the ground her blue eyes opening as she turned to head inside for dinner.

~~With Sam and Bucky~~

“Buck, there’s no way we can find someone that doesn’t want to be found,” Sam said.

“Well then Steve is just gonna have to tell us now isn’t he?” Bucky asked as he barged into Steve’s room. “

“I couldn’t stop him,” Sam warned Steve.

“So tell me who Anthony and Sydney Rogers are, and why you didn’t tell us you had a grandson and great-granddaughter sooner,” Bucky demanded.

Steve raised an eyebrow at Bucky noting his attitude. “My grandson asked me to keep him and his family out of all the ‘crazy.’ The most he has asked of me is that I get access to Tony’s files for his daughter to study since she’s gotten bored learning all she can about history.”

“Ok but where are they?” Sam asked.

“I honestly don’t remember I haven’t been there in a very long time. You could ask Peter, I know he and Sydney have been pen-pals. Sydney said she wanted to learn more about his spider powers,” Steve said.

“So you’re telling us that your great-granddaughter is some kinda Tony Stark super genius?” Sam asked.

“Yeah really,” Bucky said.

“I’m not sure what she is, but what I do know is that Pepper has given up a lot of money to let Sydney become the new Tony Stark,” Steve said.

“Well I guess it’s time to go find Parker,” Sam said. Bucky nodded and they bid their farewells to Steve and headed to the small apartment in Queens.

Once the two arrived Peter’s Aunt May answered the door and let them go see Peter who was in his room.

“Oh, Mr. Bucky, Mr. Sam w-what are you doing here?” Peter asked hiding the piece of paper he was writing on.

“What are you trying to hide Peter?” Sam asked

“Nothing!”

“Are you writing to Sydney?” Bucky asked.

“H-how did you know?” He asked.

“We asked Steve about Sydney, and her father,” Sam said. Peter nodded.

“We’re going to find her,” Bucky said. “So what’s her address?”

“Oh uh its 04 Freedom Drive in upstate New York,” Peter said already planning on going there today.

“I’m not surprised,” Sam rolled his eyes.

“I was planning on going there anyway you’re welcome to join me. She just wanted notes on the progression of my powers,” Peter said smiling grabbing his backpack and the piece of paper.

The three drove up to Sydney’s house, and they were greeted by a fairly normal house other than the fact that it looked like a mansion. Peter smiled and ran up to the door knocking just like he normally does on the weekends.

“Who is it?” A soft female voice asked.

“Peter Parker.”

The door swung open and revealed a short girl, around five foot two, with bright blue eyes, short light brown hair, thick rimmed glasses and a small smile on her face. What shocked the two older men was the fact that her father stood not too far behind her, and he looked just like Steve post-serum.

Sydney pulled Peter into the house rushing him to her lab in the basement leaving her father to deal with the two grown men that stood on the porch.

“What can I do for you two?” Her father asked.

“Uh sir we’re just wondering if we could speak to your daughter,” Sam said.

“Why?” He asked.

“You see since the Avengers are a bit sparse these days we wanted to speak to her about joining. Not for combat, but for helping develop new gear, and organizing missions,” Sam continued.

“Come in, I’ll speak to you about this. My name is Anthony by the way,” He said.

“James, but you can call me Bucky.”

“Samuel, but I prefer Sam.”

As the adults talked Peter and Sydney were calmly setting him up on her scanner. She was typing while he put on the two bracelets that had wires coming off of them.

“So how’s all of his files treating you?” Peter asked.

“Great! I know its sad that he’s gone, but I love learning everything I can from him,” she said smiling. Peter smiled watching her spin around in her lab chair to her big computer.

“Alright, scan commencing in 5… 4… 3… 2… 1…” she pointed to him and he felt a tiny shock in both wrists and then everything was done. “Alright, cool we’re done. Thanks so much Peter! I know you don’t want many people to know you’re Spiderman so this really means a lot.”

The three men that were conversing upstairs came down to see Sydney and she was pulling out a microchip to give to Peter.

“I developed something that Mr. Stark had planned in a backup file for after the fight. I hope you like it cuz this is the only way for me to thank you. I already installed it in Ms. Potts house for her and Morgan so come here,” she said waving him over.

“Can I see your suit?” Peter handed her his suit and she pulled out Karen’s chip and replaced it with the new one.

“Try it out,” she said. Peter took the garment and stepped in letting the mech suit form to his body.

“Hey kid,”

“No way….” Peter trailed off covering, what would be, his mouth.

The three adults watched. Her father was smiling proudly, while Sam and Bucky watched in shock. They hadn’t thought that she would be this advanced when they first found out about her, but this was just on a different scale.

“So tell me who Anthony and Sydney Rogers are, and why you didn’t tell us you had a grandson and great-granddaughter sooner,” Bucky demanded.

Steve raised an eyebrow at Bucky noting his attitude. “My grandson asked me to keep him and his family out of all the ‘crazy.’ The most he has asked of me is that I get access to Tony’s files for his daughter to study since she’s gotten bored learning all she can about history.”

“Ok but where are they?” Sam asked.

“I honestly don’t remember I haven’t been there in a very long time. You could ask Peter, I know he and Sydney have been pen-pals. Sydney said she wanted to learn more about his spider powers,” Steve said.

“So you’re telling us that your great-granddaughter is some kinda Tony Stark super genius?” Sam asked.

“Yeah really,” Bucky said.

“I’m not sure what she is, but what I do know is that Pepper has given up a lot of money to let Sydney become the new Tony Stark,” Steve said.

“Well I guess it’s time to go find Parker,” Sam said. Bucky nodded and they bid their farewells to Steve and headed to the small apartment in Queens.

Once the two arrived Peter’s Aunt May answered the door and let them go see Peter who was in his room.

“Oh, Mr. Bucky, Mr. Sam w-what are you doing here?” Peter asked hiding the piece of paper he was writing on.

“What are you trying to hide Peter?” Sam asked

“Nothing!”

“Are you writing to Sydney?” Bucky asked.

“H-how did you know?” He asked.

“We asked Steve about Sydney, and her father,” Sam said. Peter nodded.

“We’re going to find her,” Bucky said. “So what’s her address?”

“Oh uh its 04 Freedom Drive in upstate New York,” Peter said already planning on going there today.

“I’m not surprised,” Sam rolled his eyes.

“I was planning on going there anyway you’re welcome to join me. She just wanted notes on the progression of my powers,” Peter said smiling grabbing his backpack and the piece of paper.

The three drove up to Sydney’s house, and they were greeted by a fairly normal house other than the fact that it looked like a mansion. Peter smiled and ran up to the door knocking just like he normally does on the weekends.

“Who is it?” A soft female voice asked.

“Peter Parker.”

The door swung open and revealed a short girl, around five foot two, with bright blue eyes, short light brown hair, thick rimmed glasses and a small smile on her face. What shocked the two older men was the fact that her father stood not too far behind her, and he looked just like Steve post-serum.

Sydney pulled Peter into the house rushing him to her lab in the basement leaving her father to deal with the two grown men that stood on the porch.

“What can I do for you two?” Her father asked.

“Uh sir we’re just wondering if we could speak to your daughter,” Sam said.

“Why?” He asked.

“You see since the Avengers are a bit sparse these days we wanted to speak to her about joining. Not for combat, but for helping develop new gear, and organizing missions,” Sam continued.

“Come in, I’ll speak to you about this. My name is Anthony by the way,” He said.

“James, but you can call me Bucky.”

“Samuel, but I prefer Sam.”

As the adults talked Peter and Sydney were calmly setting him up on her scanner. She was typing while he put on the two bracelets that had wires coming off of them.

“So how’s all of his files treating you?” Peter asked.

“Great! I know its sad that he’s gone, but I love learning everything I can from him,” she said smiling. Peter smiled watching her spin around in her lab chair to her big computer.

“Alright, scan commencing in 5… 4… 3… 2… 1…” she pointed to him and he felt a tiny shock in both wrists and then everything was done. “Alright, cool we’re done. Thanks so much Peter! I know you don’t want many people to know you’re Spiderman so this really means a lot.”

The three men that were conversing upstairs came down to see Sydney and she was pulling out a microchip to give to Peter.

“I developed something that Mr. Stark had planned in a backup file for after the fight. I hope you like it cuz this is the only way for me to thank you. I already installed it in Ms. Potts house for her and Morgan so come here,” she said waving him over.

“Can I see your suit?” Peter handed her his suit and she pulled out Karen’s chip and replaced it with the new one.

“Try it out,” she said. Peter took the garment and stepped in letting the mech suit form to his body.

“Hey kid,”

“No way….” Peter trailed off covering, what would be, his mouth.

The three adults watched. Her father was smiling proudly, while Sam and Bucky watched in shock. They hadn’t thought that she would be this advanced when they first found out about her, but this was just on a different scale.

body:
Friendly Neighborhood Spiderman Pt 1

Word Count:  2680

Peter Parker/ Spiderman x Reader

A/N: So I wrote this kind of trying to make it a one and done type thing, but I ended up writing a lot, and I haven’t even gotten to what I deem as a ‘half way point.’ So I’m gonna break it up, and I’m still new to this so I will try to link the next parts below. Also, I’ve been very uncreative and I’m open to people sending me requests but I don’t want the expectation to be that I will fulfill all requests. So yeah, please give me feed back b/c while this is a creative out let for me I’d love to know what people think. 

I walked down the street towards the bus stop, my eyes glued to my phone as I read through a scientific article I needed for a project and I shoved my earbuds in and began blasting a new band I’d recently heard about. The bus hissed to a stop in front of me, and I stepped up without taking my eyes off my phone. I didn’t need to listen to the other stop names: it was 4 stops to my apartment. I turned up my music as a baby started to cry behind me.

Four stops later I hopped off the bus, and began to walk down the street as I continued to scroll. I took a left towards the coffee shop a few blocks from my apartment and walked up the block only looking up to place my hand on the door.

I ran into the door and looked up. This was not my coffee shop, instead I was looking into a dark restaurant with a health department notice taped in the window. I looked around at my surroundings and irritably sighed as I closed the article on my phone and pulled up my maps. I had no clue where I was. I retraced my steps back to the bus stop and looked to see when the next bus would arrive and checked my phone. The next bus wouldn’t be here for an hour and a half. It was starting to get dark and I began to get nervous as I looked around. I took a deep breath and decided to walk home. Stuffing my hands in my pockets I began the long walk home.

After a couple of blocks, I began to feel like I was being watched. I looked around and noticed a white car with tinted windows turn onto the otherwise empty street. A man got out of the back seat in front of the bodega behind me.

I turned as the car drove past me and stopped at the stop sign and I let out a sigh of relief as I felt my shoulders relax.

Suddenly, another man jumped out of the car and started to walk towards me. I heard footsteps behind me get closer and felt panic sweep over me. I turned toward the street and stepped off the side walk as I felt a hand grab my elbow. I tried to tug my arm out of his grip, but he pulled me back to the side walk as I struggled against him.

“Let go of me!” I shouted at him, hearing the panic in my voice as I swung my free arm to punch at him. He grabbed my other wrist and I fought against him as he began to pull me toward the car as the other man continued to walk towards us.

I started to scream for help and the man I was wrestling against pulled me toward him and clamped his hand over my mouth. I bit down onto his finger and heard him yell as I felt the warm salty taste of blood in my mouth. He let me go, and I turned to run away. I screamed as I felt the other man grab me by my hair and began to cry. My hands wrapped around the hand tangled in my hair as the man I bit slapped me across the face.

I continued to struggle as I was dragged towards the car, tears streaming down my face. The man pulling my hair opened the car door and tried to pull me down into the car with him but I braced my self against the door frame as he tugged on my hair.

“Grab her legs,” he said, and I began to kick at him as he tried to grab my ankles. The grip on my hair tightened and I shouted in pain as my head was yanked back against the man’s shoulder. “Stop- hgugh! struggling you stupid-mph- brat.”

All of a sudden there was a loud thwip, and the car door slammed on the man’s hand. There was a sticky sheet of what looked like stringy plastic wrap holding his hand to the door. He screamed and immediately let go of my hair, and the man that had been trying to grab my ankles stood up just before the same stringy substance wrapped around him and slammed him against the car. His knees buckled but he was stuck to the car from whatever that stuff was.

Stumbling backwards, I tripped over my attacker’s shoe and felt strong arms stop me from falling and immediately began to fight against them.

“Hey-ouch- stop! I-ow! Just-mph” I turned and took a few clumsy steps backwards. I was standing in front of Spiderman. “It’s okay! I’m not gonna hurt you.”

I felt my shoulders relax, only to jump away from the car as the driver opened the door. It slammed shut as Spiderman shot a string at him from his hand.

“Just a sec,” I heard him say as he leapt up on to the car and began to shoot that stuff around the car, making sure the doors wouldn’t open again. He jumped off the car And landed right in front of me.

“Are you okay?” He asked. His voice sounded… familiar. I tilted my head trying to place his voice. He couldn’t have been much older than me. “Hello?”

“Um, yeah,” I said, glancing back at the car. I felt a lump in my throat and took a deep, shaky breath. “As okay as someone can be after almost being abducted.”

He turned to look down the street and looked back at me.

“Here,” he said, holding his hand out. “Let me take you home.”

I glanced down at his hand, and nervously bit my lip. I looked back up at him and he nodded. I tentatively placed my hand in his, and he pulled me into his chest.

“Hang on to me,” he said and I wrapped my arms around his neck, blushing as he wrapped his arm around my waist and pulled me against him.

He lifted his arm and before I knew it we were soaring into the air. I gasped loudly and his grip tightened as he held me against him. I pressed my face into the crook of his neck, clinging to him for dear life.

“Can I get some directions?” he asked into my ear.

“Oh-uh- yeah,” I said, turning my head as he carefully shifted me so I could see where we were going. I began to direct him and we flew through the streets, and every so often I’d feel his grip tighten around my waist. After about 5 minutes, I could see my apartment building.

“There,” I said nodding towards the brick building. “The front door is on the other side of the building.”

“I can take you straight to your room if you want,” he said as we got closer. “If you’ve missed curfew or something.”

“The front door is fine,” I said. I couldn’t stop trying to place his voice, I’d heard that voice from somewhere before.

He nodded and swung us around the building and into an alley across the street. My feet touched the ground and I felt his other hand on my waist, stabilizing me as I stumbled a little.

“Thank you,” I said sheepishly as I let go of him and took a few steps away from him.

“Well, you were a long way from home,” he said. “And I wasn’t gonna let-”

“No, not for the lift,” I said, trying to decide what to tell my parents. “Those guys-I don’t know what I…”

I trailed off and looked at the ground as I felt tears building in the corners of my eyes. I saw him moving in my peripherals and flinched when I felt his hand on my shoulder.

“Hey,” I looked up at the man in the mask. “You’re safe now. You’re home.”

I glanced over at the apartments and Spiderman’s hand left my shoulder. When I turned back he was half way up the building.

“Do I know you?” I shouted, making him look down at me. He seemed to freeze above me and he muttered something under his breath.

“Uh… yeah! Yeah, of course you do!” he said as he climbed the rest of the way up the building.

“Really?”

I took a few steps back so I could still see him as he climbed over the roof and looked over the edge at me. The white eye pieces on his mask narrowed as if he was scrutinizing me.

“I’m your Friendly Neighborhood Spiderman!”

And then he was gone, leaving me alone in the darkened alley.

——————

I decided not to tell anyone what had happened. Even if I did, who was going to believe my story? I walked up the steps to Midtown High and sighed as I weaved in and out of students.

Same shit as always, I thought to myself. I reached my locker and began to sort through what I needed for first and second period.

Someone walked up from behind me and leaned against the locker next to me. I looked over and smiled at MJ. She looked irritated, but then again, she always looks like that.

“Have you done the calc study guide yet?” she asked, crossing her arms.

“No,” I huffed fishing a binder out of my backpack. “But keep reminding me. If I don’t get at least an A- I’m going to fail the class.”

“You don’t need to be rude,” she said uncrossing her arms as I shut my locker. We started down the hall. “And a B is not failing.”

At the end of the hall I caught sight of Ned and Peter and immediately felt my stomach to a flip.

MJ noticed.

“Maybe Peter can help,” she said elbowing me in the ribs.

“Fuck off,” I said elbowing her back.

“Hey, just a suggestion,” she said as I opened the door to our biology classroom. “If you’re dead set on that A- and I know you are- it might be a good idea.”

“MJ,” I said seriously. “Drop it.”

She shrugged at me and we sat next to each other on the same lab bench. We quipped back and forth while more students took their seats. Peter and Ned sat across from us and I caught Peter’s eye as he pulled out the chair in front of MJ. He smiled at me as he sat down. I smiled and quickly looked away to hide my pink cheeks.

As class started I immediately lost focus and rested my chin in the palm of my hand. As much as I loved the idea of Peter tutoring me, I knew I’d never be able to focus. I glanced over at him as he copied notes from the board. His curly brown hair covering his eyes as he leaned over his notebook. Every now and then he’d look up and rest his chin in the palm of his hand and I could briefly see the light hit his brown eyes.

My butt vibrated, pulling me back to the classroom. I glanced up to check that our teacher wasn’t looking and pulled my phone out of my back pocket. It was a text from MJ.

MJ: ur eyes glaze over when ur day dreaming

I looked over to see her discretely holding her notebook so I could clearly see what she’d drawn. It was a cartoon version of me with hearts for eyes and drool dripping from my mouth. I texted back the middle finger emoji and put my phone in my backpack, signaling to MJ that I was done talking about Peter… for now.

I continued to day dream and vaguely heard our teacher wrapping up his lecture and going over the specifics for the project.

“And it’s due a week from today, so next Wednesday,” he said, reaching for a sheet of paper on his desk. He began reading names from his list and two by two students stood up and met at the door to leave.

“Michelle -Ned…”

Ned stood up in front of me and MJ didn’t move, continuing to scroll through her phone.

“(Y/N)- Peter…”

My eyes widened and I felt my cheeks begin to get warm. I glanced at Peter and we both sheepishly smiled at each other. Out of the corner of my eye I could see MJ as she turned to look at me with that stupid shit eating grin on her face. She got up so quickly it was almost comical, and she made a big show about getting Ned to walk with her to “discuss the project.”

I stood up and turned to meet Peter at the end of the lab bench. We awkwardly greeted each other and began to leave class, our shoulders brushing against each other every couple steps.

“I’ve already been reading a couple articles,” I said, as I turned down the hall towards my locker. My heart fluttered as I noted that this had been the first one-on-one conversation I’d ever had with him. “But if you have something else, we can do that…”

“I haven’t really looked into anything, yet,” he said, glancing up from the floor at me. When his eyes met mine I felt my cheeks getting warm again and quickly looked away.

“We can talk about it more after school,” he said, quickly. ”Do you want to work on it at my place or your place- unless you’re not comfortable with- we can meet in a more public-“

“We can go to your place, if you want?” I said uncertainly. “My parents are super nosy and we’d never get anything done..”

“So we’ll meet up after school?” he asked, pulling out his phone. He seemed nervous but he was also smiling, so I couldn’t tell what he was thinking. “Do I already have your number?”

I shook my head and we exchanged numbers as we rounded the corner. I looked up and saw MJ and Ned standing at my locker whispering to each other. As soon as we were within ear shot the stopped talking and there was an awkward silence as we all stared at each other.

“Nothing,” Ned blurted nervously. MJ rolled her eyes.

“Smooth, Ned. Smooth,” she said. He looked a little embarrassed and quickly changed the subject.

“Are we gonna start the new lego set I got after school today?” Ned asked Peter. “I finally got the Millennium Falcon.”

I opened my locker and saw Peter scratching the back of his neck out of the corner of my eye.

“Actually, (Y/N) and I are gonna start working on our project after school,” Peter said.

I shut my locker and turned around as Ned was about to start complaining but MJ cut in.

“Maybe you can help (Y/N) with her calc study guide,” she said. I glared at her as Peter turned to look at her. “The test is Friday and she won’t shut up about how she’s gonna fail.”

“If you want I can help you with the study guide today, and we can start on the project today and finish it over the weekend,” he said, looking back at me. I glanced at MJ behind Peter’s back and she gave me a subtle thumbs up.

“Uh… sure,” I said tucking a stray hair behind my ear. My cheeks felt like they were burning as he smiled back at me. “I mean, you don’t mind do you?”

“Are you kidding?” Ned said. “Pet-“

“Yeah, it’s no trouble,” Peter said quickly, glancing at Ned. “We have to get going- to, uh, class.”

Ned looked confused, but didn’t respond and began to follow Peter. I watched them leave and turned back to MJ who was grinning back down at me.

“Not a single word,” I said as I turned away from my locker and she followed me off to second period, cackling.

Friendly Neighborhood Spiderman Pt 1

Word Count:  2680

Peter Parker/ Spiderman x Reader

A/N: So I wrote this kind of trying to make it a one and done type thing, but I ended up writing a lot, and I haven’t even gotten to what I deem as a ‘half way point.’ So I’m gonna break it up, and I’m still new to this so I will try to link the next parts below. Also, I’ve been very uncreative and I’m open to people sending me requests but I don’t want the expectation to be that I will fulfill all requests. So yeah, please give me feed back b/c while this is a creative out let for me I’d love to know what people think. 

I walked down the street towards the bus stop, my eyes glued to my phone as I read through a scientific article I needed for a project and I shoved my earbuds in and began blasting a new band I’d recently heard about. The bus hissed to a stop in front of me, and I stepped up without taking my eyes off my phone. I didn’t need to listen to the other stop names: it was 4 stops to my apartment. I turned up my music as a baby started to cry behind me.

Four stops later I hopped off the bus, and began to walk down the street as I continued to scroll. I took a left towards the coffee shop a few blocks from my apartment and walked up the block only looking up to place my hand on the door.

I ran into the door and looked up. This was not my coffee shop, instead I was looking into a dark restaurant with a health department notice taped in the window. I looked around at my surroundings and irritably sighed as I closed the article on my phone and pulled up my maps. I had no clue where I was. I retraced my steps back to the bus stop and looked to see when the next bus would arrive and checked my phone. The next bus wouldn’t be here for an hour and a half. It was starting to get dark and I began to get nervous as I looked around. I took a deep breath and decided to walk home. Stuffing my hands in my pockets I began the long walk home.

After a couple of blocks, I began to feel like I was being watched. I looked around and noticed a white car with tinted windows turn onto the otherwise empty street. A man got out of the back seat in front of the bodega behind me.

I turned as the car drove past me and stopped at the stop sign and I let out a sigh of relief as I felt my shoulders relax.

Suddenly, another man jumped out of the car and started to walk towards me. I heard footsteps behind me get closer and felt panic sweep over me. I turned toward the street and stepped off the side walk as I felt a hand grab my elbow. I tried to tug my arm out of his grip, but he pulled me back to the side walk as I struggled against him.

“Let go of me!” I shouted at him, hearing the panic in my voice as I swung my free arm to punch at him. He grabbed my other wrist and I fought against him as he began to pull me toward the car as the other man continued to walk towards us.

I started to scream for help and the man I was wrestling against pulled me toward him and clamped his hand over my mouth. I bit down onto his finger and heard him yell as I felt the warm salty taste of blood in my mouth. He let me go, and I turned to run away. I screamed as I felt the other man grab me by my hair and began to cry. My hands wrapped around the hand tangled in my hair as the man I bit slapped me across the face.

I continued to struggle as I was dragged towards the car, tears streaming down my face. The man pulling my hair opened the car door and tried to pull me down into the car with him but I braced my self against the door frame as he tugged on my hair.

“Grab her legs,” he said, and I began to kick at him as he tried to grab my ankles. The grip on my hair tightened and I shouted in pain as my head was yanked back against the man’s shoulder. “Stop- hgugh! struggling you stupid-mph- brat.”

All of a sudden there was a loud thwip, and the car door slammed on the man’s hand. There was a sticky sheet of what looked like stringy plastic wrap holding his hand to the door. He screamed and immediately let go of my hair, and the man that had been trying to grab my ankles stood up just before the same stringy substance wrapped around him and slammed him against the car. His knees buckled but he was stuck to the car from whatever that stuff was.

Stumbling backwards, I tripped over my attacker’s shoe and felt strong arms stop me from falling and immediately began to fight against them.

“Hey-ouch- stop! I-ow! Just-mph” I turned and took a few clumsy steps backwards. I was standing in front of Spiderman. “It’s okay! I’m not gonna hurt you.”

I felt my shoulders relax, only to jump away from the car as the driver opened the door. It slammed shut as Spiderman shot a string at him from his hand.

“Just a sec,” I heard him say as he leapt up on to the car and began to shoot that stuff around the car, making sure the doors wouldn’t open again. He jumped off the car And landed right in front of me.

“Are you okay?” He asked. His voice sounded… familiar. I tilted my head trying to place his voice. He couldn’t have been much older than me. “Hello?”

“Um, yeah,” I said, glancing back at the car. I felt a lump in my throat and took a deep, shaky breath. “As okay as someone can be after almost being abducted.”

He turned to look down the street and looked back at me.

“Here,” he said, holding his hand out. “Let me take you home.”

I glanced down at his hand, and nervously bit my lip. I looked back up at him and he nodded. I tentatively placed my hand in his, and he pulled me into his chest.

“Hang on to me,” he said and I wrapped my arms around his neck, blushing as he wrapped his arm around my waist and pulled me against him.

He lifted his arm and before I knew it we were soaring into the air. I gasped loudly and his grip tightened as he held me against him. I pressed my face into the crook of his neck, clinging to him for dear life.

“Can I get some directions?” he asked into my ear.

“Oh-uh- yeah,” I said, turning my head as he carefully shifted me so I could see where we were going. I began to direct him and we flew through the streets, and every so often I’d feel his grip tighten around my waist. After about 5 minutes, I could see my apartment building.

“There,” I said nodding towards the brick building. “The front door is on the other side of the building.”

“I can take you straight to your room if you want,” he said as we got closer. “If you’ve missed curfew or something.”

“The front door is fine,” I said. I couldn’t stop trying to place his voice, I’d heard that voice from somewhere before.

He nodded and swung us around the building and into an alley across the street. My feet touched the ground and I felt his other hand on my waist, stabilizing me as I stumbled a little.

“Thank you,” I said sheepishly as I let go of him and took a few steps away from him.

“Well, you were a long way from home,” he said. “And I wasn’t gonna let-”

“No, not for the lift,” I said, trying to decide what to tell my parents. “Those guys-I don’t know what I…”

I trailed off and looked at the ground as I felt tears building in the corners of my eyes. I saw him moving in my peripherals and flinched when I felt his hand on my shoulder.

“Hey,” I looked up at the man in the mask. “You’re safe now. You’re home.”

I glanced over at the apartments and Spiderman’s hand left my shoulder. When I turned back he was half way up the building.

“Do I know you?” I shouted, making him look down at me. He seemed to freeze above me and he muttered something under his breath.

“Uh… yeah! Yeah, of course you do!” he said as he climbed the rest of the way up the building.

“Really?”

I took a few steps back so I could still see him as he climbed over the roof and looked over the edge at me. The white eye pieces on his mask narrowed as if he was scrutinizing me.

“I’m your Friendly Neighborhood Spiderman!”

And then he was gone, leaving me alone in the darkened alley.

——————

I decided not to tell anyone what had happened. Even if I did, who was going to believe my story? I walked up the steps to Midtown High and sighed as I weaved in and out of students.

Same shit as always, I thought to myself. I reached my locker and began to sort through what I needed for first and second period.

Someone walked up from behind me and leaned against the locker next to me. I looked over and smiled at MJ. She looked irritated, but then again, she always looks like that.

“Have you done the calc study guide yet?” she asked, crossing her arms.

“No,” I huffed fishing a binder out of my backpack. “But keep reminding me. If I don’t get at least an A- I’m going to fail the class.”

“You don’t need to be rude,” she said uncrossing her arms as I shut my locker. We started down the hall. “And a B is not failing.”

At the end of the hall I caught sight of Ned and Peter and immediately felt my stomach to a flip.

MJ noticed.

“Maybe Peter can help,” she said elbowing me in the ribs.

“Fuck off,” I said elbowing her back.

“Hey, just a suggestion,” she said as I opened the door to our biology classroom. “If you’re dead set on that A- and I know you are- it might be a good idea.”

“MJ,” I said seriously. “Drop it.”

She shrugged at me and we sat next to each other on the same lab bench. We quipped back and forth while more students took their seats. Peter and Ned sat across from us and I caught Peter’s eye as he pulled out the chair in front of MJ. He smiled at me as he sat down. I smiled and quickly looked away to hide my pink cheeks.

As class started I immediately lost focus and rested my chin in the palm of my hand. As much as I loved the idea of Peter tutoring me, I knew I’d never be able to focus. I glanced over at him as he copied notes from the board. His curly brown hair covering his eyes as he leaned over his notebook. Every now and then he’d look up and rest his chin in the palm of his hand and I could briefly see the light hit his brown eyes.

Ned stood up in front of me and MJ didn’t move, continuing to scroll through her phone.

“(Y/N)- Peter…”

Out of the corner of my eye I could see MJ as she turned to look at me with that stupid shit eating grin on her face. “We can go to your place, if you want?” I said uncertainly. “My parents are super nosy and we’d never get anything done..”

I shut my locker and turned around as Ned was about to start complaining but MJ cut in.

“If you want I can help you with the study guide today, and we can start on the project today and finish it over the weekend,” he said, looking back at me. I glanced at MJ behind Peter’s back and she gave me a subtle thumbs up.

“Uh… sure,” I said tucking a stray hair behind my ear. My cheeks felt like they were burning as he smiled back at me. “I mean, you don’t mind do you?”

I opened my locker and saw Peter scratching the back of his neck out of the corner of my eye.

“Actually, (Y/N) and I are gonna start working on our project after school,” Peter said.

I shut my locker and turned around as Ned was about to start complaining but MJ cut in.

“Maybe you can help (Y/N) with her calc study guide,” she said. I glared at her as Peter turned to look at her. “The test is Friday and she won’t shut up about how she’s gonna fail.”

“If you want I can help you with the study guide today, and we can start on the project today and finish it over the weekend,” he said, looking back at me. I glanced at MJ behind Peter’s back and she gave me a subtle thumbs up.

“Uh… sure,” I said tucking a stray hair behind my ear. My cheeks felt like they were burning as he smiled back at me. “I mean, you don’t mind do you?”

“Are you kidding?” Ned said. “Pet-“

“Yeah, it’s no trouble,” Peter said quickly, glancing at Ned. “We have to get going- to, uh, class.”

Ned looked confused, but didn’t respond and began to follow Peter. I watched them leave and turned back to MJ who was grinning back down at me.

“Not a single word,” I said as I turned away from my locker and she followed me off to second period, cackling.

title: Paint my memory
body:
A little bit of Morgan Stark angst. Around 1k words. Spoilers for Endgame ahead!! 

Sometimes, Morgan gets mad. Really mad. She’s a smart girl, and the worst part is that she knows she is. But no matter what a genius she might be, emotional maturity is something she can only gain with age.

Morgan is sixteen, and she’s pissed.

Mom is away. She had an emergency company trip to Asia, somewhere in Japan. Morgan doesn’t actually care. This happens a lot. Mom is old now, but she has always been a workaholic. She used to say Dad was like that, he was way worse. She doesn’t talk about dad very much anymore.

It’s been like that for years. Like he’s fading away.

Morgan wishes she could remember him. She has some memories, but they’re vage. Those kinds of very early memories she’s not really sure if they’re real, a dream, a reconstruction of stories she’s heard from other people, or a combination of all three. It’s not like she doesn’t know how he looks like: in the decade that has passed since his death, Tony Stark’s image has become almost like a pagan saint. Everywhere she goes, somewhere, there’s something of him. A sticker on a school binder, someone with an Iron Man phone case, the new biopic that’s coming out with that stupid actor who harassed Mom for like a month…

The giant Iron Man mural in the park a few blocks away from her school. And Morgan hates it.

It’s so corny. People even leave flowers and candles sometimes. She once saw one of her classmates praying to the image of her deceased father for a good grade on his algebra test. Some inexplicable rage had taken over her body that day, and she had then proceeded to “accidentally” make the boy’s backpack explode. He hadn’t been wearing it, and Morgan explained that she didn’t want to physically harm him, no matter how much Mom had screamed.

But that day, it’s dark. It’s going to rain. She’s carrying spray paint, because Miles had asked her to drop by the store close to her school and get him that new shade of red he was dying to try.

And Morgan is pissed.

But she’s also an idiot. At least when it comes to her emotional processing anyway. So when the cops catch her drawing obscenities over the stupid mural, she doesn’t have any better idea than to run. And she gets caught, easily. Because she can’t run fast, or jump buildings, or climb walls, or fly. She isn’t special like that. Sometimes she feels like she isn’t special at all.

“How old are you?” asks the police woman sitting by the desk. Morgan fidgets with her handcuffs, her eyes glued to the ground.

“Sixteen.”

“Where do you live?”

She can’t really answer that, can she? The lake house had stopped being a home years ago. The apartment in Manhattan is almost always empty. The mansion in California is her favourite place, but is not a home.

“Queens,” she lies. The policewoman keeps writing down everything in her computer. She seems pissed.

Another policeman walks by the desk and stopps to read the computer screen. He makes a strange face and then turns to Morgan.

“Vandalizing an Iron Man memorial? What the hell’s your problem, kid?”

Morgan feels her cheeks turn red and her neck heat up. She would snap back at him if it wouldn’t make her situation way worse.

The policewoman doesn’t even blink. “Read her name, Carl.”

The guy, Carl, opens his eyes like plates once he reads her name on the computer. He looks confused, then laughs.

“Well, I guess we all get pissed at our folks from time to time,” he says, and then walks away laughing.

Morgan feels mortified. The police woman keeps taking her information and remains indifferent.

“I need the phone number of your mother, a tutor, or responsible adult that can come to pick you up. Then I’ll discuss with them the terms of your penalizing.”

Calling Mom is impossible, she’s on the other side of the globe. Happy would come, but she would sell her out to mom. Same with Uncle Rhodey. She had no other option.

“What the hell did you do now?” asks Peter’s very tired voice from behind her. Morgan raises her head to meet him as he enters the police station. He looks exhausted, and Morgan feels awful for dragging him all the way across the city for this.

“You must be Mr. Parker,” greets him the policewoman, and proceeds to explain to him the situation. As the seconds pass, Morgan can feel Peter’s increasing glare into her neck, but she remains with her eyes to the ground.

After deciding that paying a penalty fee should be enough punishment, they let them go. She’s relieved, the fee is about ten grand, and she can easily pay that from her allowance without Mom finding out. What she doesn’t expect is Peter’s judgmental face when she informs him.

“You know you got lucky, right?,” he says, very slowly. Morgan frowns.

“I got caught.”

“No, not because of that. You got away with it.”

She doesn’t understand. “I’m paying a fee-”

Peter lets out a bitter laugh. “Yeah, pocket money for you. You got away with a pat in the back. How do you think this situation would’ve ended up if Miles had gotten caught doing what you were doing?”

Morgan stares at him. “He wouldn’t have been caught, because he’s spiderman. He can run from the police.”

Now, Peter is definitely mad. “And he’s also not a white rich brat.”

He has a good point, but Morgan won’t allow him to berate her. “Why are you so mad? It’s just a graffiti.”

Peter doesn’t answer for a few seconds. It almost looks like he won’t.

“It wasn’t any mural that you destroyed, Mo. It was an Iron Man Memorial. I honestly can’t understand how incredibly disrespectful-”

“Why do you care so much?” interrupts him Morgan, “He wasn’t your father.”

An ugly silence settles between them. For some reason, Morgan feels like crying. She doesn’t let any tears betray her, and keeps looking at Peter, challenging.

He doesn’t look mad anymore, just sad. He can’t meet her eyes.

“No,” he says after a long minute. “No he wasn’t.”

Morgan crosses her arms in her chest, not feeling the gratification of the win at all.

“But?”

Peter sighs. “But he was yours. You should have more respect for that.”

They don’t say much else after that. Peter walks her to her apartment, talks to Happy and MJ over the phone, orders a pizza, and stays the night with her. Morgan just wants him gone. She just wants to be alone.

When Peter wakes her up the next morning with breakfast and her lunch ready for school, she asks for forgiveness. There’s nothing to forgive, Mo, he says, but it feels empty. When he leaves for work and leaves her alone in her huge apartment that she occasionally shares with her mother and an ever present ghost, only then she allows herself to cry.

Everywhere she goes, somewhere, there’s something of him. A sticker on a school binder, someone with an Iron Man phone case, the new biopic that’s coming out with that stupid actor who harassed Mom for like a month…

The giant Iron Man mural in the park a few blocks away from her school. And Morgan hates it.

It’s so corny. People even leave flowers and candles sometimes. She once saw one of her classmates praying to the image of her deceased father for a good grade on his algebra test. Some inexplicable rage had taken over her body that day, and she had then proceeded to “accidentally” make the boy’s backpack explode. He hadn’t been wearing it, and Morgan explained that she didn’t want to physically harm him, no matter how much Mom had screamed.

But that day, it’s dark. It’s going to rain. She’s carrying spray paint, because Miles had asked her to drop by the store close to her school and get him that new shade of red he was dying to try.

And Morgan is pissed.

Like what is the line here really? I see many blogs call starker shippers “disgusting” because they ship an adult with a minor but I see people that ships aged up Peter with Tony gets this sort of hate too. It’s almost like you guys just hate starker. It’s okay to hate a ship but to hate on a person just because they ship something you disagree with is fucking immature. Grow the fuck up and let people ship whatever fictional ships they want.
